snippet: The Obama campaign said it was refunding more than $200,000 raised by the family of a casino magnate linked to violence and corruption in Mexico who has been seeking a pardon.
abstract: Pres Barack Obama's re-election campaign announces that it will refund more than $200,000 in donations from the family of Mexican casino magnate Juan Jose Rojas Cardona, who fled drug and fraud charges in the United States and has been seeking a pardon to return; Obama campaign officials say that at the time they accepted the large donations from two American members of the Cardona family, they were unaware that the Mexican fugitive is their brother.
lead_paragraph: The Obama campaign said it was refunding more than $200,000 raised by the family of a casino magnate linked to violence and corruption in Mexico who has been seeking a pardon.

headline.seo: Major Obama Donors Are Tied to Pepe Cardona, Mexican Fugitive
headline.main: Obama to Return Major Donations Tied to Fugitive
headline.print_headline: Obama To Return Major Donations Tied To Fugitive
